Description: Red pottery tripod stand with a very rough underside, broken through with a hole. Repaired from three pieces. One of the three projections is broken off and missing.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, Findspot 51, domestic buildings in the urban area to the east of the Saite enclosure (so-called "Camp").
Curator's comments: W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 65 § 61, pl. xxxiii, 9 : "stand for trays or dishes"..."not common elsewhere; 9 is found in all parts of the plain at Defenneh, and may be a stool for sitting on". The Findspot number 51 has been scratched onto the internal wall of the object. see the similar item Boston, MFA, 87.627.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 61 § 58, p. 65, 66 § 61, pl. xxxiii, 9)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.111, p.220, pl.62)
